name: Rule
overview:
This class allows you interact with Compute Engine.

First, install @google-cloud/compute with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/compute

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/computeâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var gce = require('@google-cloud/compute')();

Elsewhere

var gce = require('@google-cloud/compute')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/compute are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Rule
methods.description: Forwarding rules work in conjunction with target pools and target instances to support load balancing and protocol forwarding features. To use load balancing and protocol forwarding, you must create a forwarding rule that directs traffic to specific target pools (for load balancing) or target instances (for protocol forwarding).

examples.caption: Reference a region rule.
examples.code:
var region = gce.region('us-central1');
var rule = region.rule('rule-name');

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: config
params.description: • See compute#createRule or compute/region#createRule if accessing this object through a Region.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: get
methods.description:
Get a forwarding rule if it exists.

You may optionally use this to "get or create" an object by providing an object with autoCreate set to true. Any extra configuration that is normally required for the create method must be contained within this object as well.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.autoCreate
params.description: • Automatically create the object if it does not exist. Default: false

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.operation
params.description: • An operation object that can be used to check the status of the request.

methods.name: setTarget
methods.description: Set the target for this forwarding rule.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: target
params.description: • The full or valid partial URL of the target resource to receive the matched traffic. For regional forwarding rules, this target must live in the same region as the forwarding rule. For global forwarding rules, this target must be a global TargetHttpProxy resource.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.
